page.title: 07Employment & Travel
page.content: We did a survey in Weston Turville School and found out that 91% of fathers go to work, 55% of mothers go to work, 11% of sisters work,and 13% of brothers work.We did not count Saturday jobs or paper rounds for employment. Then we surveyed the times they worked.77% of fathers work 9-5,4% work 9-1,and 19% of fathers work shifts.33% of mothers work 9-5,35% work 9-1,and 32% of mothers work shifts.76% of sisters work all day.None work 9-1,and 24% work shifts.84% of brothers work 9-5,none work 9-1,and 16% work shifts. Over 316 parents of Weston Turville School pupils use a means of transport to travel to work.The most popular transport is the car.Altogether 236 parents travel this way.The least most popular is the motorbike.Bicycle,bus, train, and walking were about the same at 10 parents each.
